module.p:
rach seachad go past –
pedagogical examples –
An deach sibh tarsainn air an abhainn no seachad air Càrn Sheumais?
Did you go across the river or past Càrn Sheumais? td. 99
Cha do dh’fhairich sinn an oidhche a’ dol seachad.
We didn’t feel the night passing. td. 165 figurative

Note the following idiomatic use – rach seachad air ignore –
pedagogical examples –
[...] ach uaireannan tha e duilich a dhol seachad orra
[...] but sometimes it’s difficult to ignore them td. 477

section.p:
Examples from Gairm –
[...] A nis, tha an Taghadh Nàiseanta seachad, agus tha Riaghaltas ùr againn. Tha sinn an dòchas gun téid gu math dhaibh, agus gun cuir iad spionnadh ás ùr anns an dùthaich air fad. Agus gu seachd àraidh anns a’ Ghaidhealtachd: [...]
[...] Now, the General Election is over, and we have a new Government. We hope that they will do well, and that they will re-energise the whole country. And most especially in the Highlands: [...] td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
[...] ’S bha iad ’nan suidhe an sin ag òl uisge-beatha fad na h-oidhch’, na ceathrar aca. An dràsda ’s a rithist shealladh Iain a-mach air an uinneig ris a’ mhuir ’s na h-eileanan. Chitheadh e aig amannan na faoileagan a’ gabhail seachad, ’s chluinneadh e an cuid sgriachail. [...]
[...] And they were sat there drinking whisky all night, the four of them. Now and again John would look out the window at the sea and the islands. He could see at times the gulls going past, and he could hear their screeching. [...] td. 169, le Iain Mac a’ Ghobhainn
